lead_paragraph: ATTRACTIONS Museums and Sites AMERICAN MUSEUM OF THE MOVING IMAGE, 34-12 36th Street, at 35th Avenue, Astoria, Queens. ''Critical Passions: Movies Selected by the New York Film Critics Circle,'' through Sunday. Tomorrow at 1 p.m., Michelangelo Antonioni's ''Blow-Up'' (1966), introduced by Marshall Fine of the Gannett News Service; at 3:30, Sam Peckinpah's ''Wild Bunch'' (1969), introduced by Terrence Rafferty of GQ; at 6:30 p.m., Francis Ford Coppola's ''Apocalypse Now'' (1979), introduced by Jonathan Foreman of The New York Post. Sunday at 2 p.m., Cameron Crowe's ''Say Anything'' (1989), introduced by Matt Zoller Seitz of The New York Press; at 4:30 p.m., John Schlesinger's ''Sunday Bloody Sunday'' (1971), introduced by Lisa Schwarzbaum of Entertainment Weekly. Museum admission: $8.50; 65+ and students, $5.50; ages 5 to 18, $4.50; 4 and under, free. Information: (718) 784-0077.
